answers.answer: Zeldox is less likely to cause prolactin elevation. If that doesn't work out Abilify is another option. There are no differences in how effective the atypical antipsychotics are, except for Clozaril which is used less because of potential blood dyscreias. But as regards the other atypicals every person reacts differently to each one so I would say give it a try and if it doesn't work out Abilify would probably be the next one they would use. And there are medications in study such as the glutamate antagonists which are far more effective and don't cause tardive dyskinesia, diabetes or prolactin elevation.I'm on glycine an antipsychotic in Phase II FDA study and have made a full recovery as defined by my psychopharmocologist. I will post the link when the study is published. Here's the official study:http://www.schizophrenia.com/research/javitt.htmAnd  link to all medications in study:http://www.psychmeds123.info/Which updates itself. In the meantime see how you react to what you are on and then make a decision from there. Each person is different. Best wishes with your recovery and keep us updated.
